actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 60 (Sen. Scott, of FL):
        A resolution honoring the memories of the victims of the senseless attack at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School on February 14, 2018.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 61 (Sen. Grassley):
        A resolution designating March 3, 2023, as "National Speech and Debate Education Day".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 62 (Sen. Braun):
        A resolution recognizing the Little Sisters of the Poor of Indianapolis on its 150th Anniversary.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 63 (Sen. Booker):
        A resolution celebrating Black History Month.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.


 S.Res. 64 (Sen. Schumer):
        A resolution to authorize testimony and representation in United States v. GossJankowski.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN71:
        Adrienne C. Nelson, of Oregon, to be United States District Judge for the District of Oregon

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 44. Record Vote Number: 16 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote 2/15/2023.


 PN72:
        Matthew L. Garcia, of New Mexico, to be United States District Judge for the District of New Mexico

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 45. Record Vote Number: 14 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 46. Record Vote Number: 15 



 PN74:
        Lindsay C. Jenkins, of Illinois, to be United States District Judge for the Northern District of Illinois

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 58 - 41. Record Vote Number: 12 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 59 - 40. Record Vote Number: 13 



 PN79:
        Gina R. Mendez-Miro, of Puerto Rico, to be United States District Judge for the District of Puerto Rico

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 45. Record Vote Number: 11
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  7:03 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
